Blogging Basics

Jul 19th, 2011

Octopress offers some rake tasks to create post and pages preloaded with metadata and according to Jekyll’s naming conventions. It also generates a global and a category based feed for your posts (You can find them in atom.xml and blog/categories//atom.xml). Blog Posts

Blog posts must be stored in the source/_posts directory and named according to Jekyll’s naming conventions: YYYY-MM-DD-post-title.markdown. The name of the file will be used as the url slug, and the date helps with file distinction and determines the sorting order for post loops.

Octopress provides a rake task to create new blog posts with the right naming conventions, with sensible yaml metadata. Syntax

rake new_post[“title”]

new_post expects a naturally
